<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Bayes-and-the-worried-parents">Bayes and the worried parents<a class="anchor-link" href="#Bayes-and-the-worried-parents">¶</a></h1><h3 id="A-simple-(morbid)-example-of-how-to-use-Bayes'-theorem-to-update-beliefs-in-light-of-new-data.">A simple (morbid) example of how to use Bayes' theorem to update beliefs in light of new data.<a class="anchor-link" href="#A-simple-(morbid)-example-of-how-to-use-Bayes'-theorem-to-update-beliefs-in-light-of-new-data.">¶</a></h3><p>Notebook author: Patrick von Glehn</p>
<p>Example adapted from one given by a listener on the BBC 4 radio program More or Less.</p>
<h2 id="The-scenario">The scenario<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-scenario">¶</a></h2><p>Every Sunday I go to my parents' house for dinner. After a lovely evening we say goodbye, I get in my car and travel 10 miles home. My parents always insist that I call them as soon as I get home and as I'm a good boy I almost always call, but occasionally, maybe twice a year, I forget. Last time this happened my parents phoned me after they couldn't bare waiting anymore and gave me an earful, saying that I had them worried sick that I'd had a terrible accident and died.</p>
<p>I tell them that the reverend Bayes says there was never any need to worry...</p>
<p>Bayesian statistics can be used to update our beliefs in light of new data. Let's see how my parents should have rationally updated their beliefs about my vital status given that I hadn't called after driving home from our Sunday dinner.</p>
<h3 id="Spoiler:-with-probability-99.99995%-I-was-fine-and-just-forgot-to-call">Spoiler: with probability 99.99995% I was fine and just forgot to call<a class="anchor-link" href="#Spoiler:-with-probability-99.99995%-I-was-fine-and-just-forgot-to-call">¶</a></h3><h2 id="Bayes'-theorem">Bayes' theorem<a class="anchor-link" href="#Bayes'-theorem">¶</a></h2><p>Using Bayes' theorem we can calculate, P(A|B): the probability of event A happening given event B has happened if we know (or can estimate) the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>P(A): the probability of event A happening under any circumstances (before seeing the data)</li>
<li>P(B|A): the probability of event B happening given event A has happened</li>
<li>P(B): the probability of event B happening under any circumstances<blockquote>$P(A|B) = \frac{P(A)P(B|A)}{P(B)} $ </blockquote></li>
</ul>
<p>In our case we want to calculate P(A|B): the probability that I had a fatal car accident given that I didn't call my parents after leaving their house. To do the calculation we need:</p>
<ul>
<li>P(A): the probability of having a fatal car accident in a 10 mile stretch</li>
<li>P(B|A): the probability that I don't call given that I have had a fatal car accident (certain)</li>
<li>P(B): the probability that I don't call, either because I forgot or because I'm dead</li>
</ul>
<p>Source for data: Department for Transport, Reported road casualties in Great Britain 2018 annual <a href="https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/834585/reported-road-casualties-annual-report-2018.pdf">report</a></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># P(A): calculate the chance of dying in a 10 mile stretch from data about UK road fatalities</span>
<span class="n">UK_fatalities_per_billion_miles_car</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.8</span>
<span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_car</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">UK_fatalities_per_billion_miles_car</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mf">10.0</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">8</span> 
<span class="n">P_not_dying_in_10_miles_car</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_car</span>

<span class="c1"># P(B|A): I definitely won't call if I'm dead</span>
<span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

<span class="c1"># P(B): I forget to call about twice a year (52 weeks)</span>
<span class="c1"># The probability that I don't call under any circumstances =</span>
<span class="c1"># The probability that I arrive safely and then don't call + the probability that I die and then don't call</span>

<span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_not_dead</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">52</span>
<span class="n">P_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_not_dying_in_10_miles_car</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_not_dead</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_car</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Now let's calculate the final answer...</span>
<span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_car</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call</span>

<span class="n">chance_per_million</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"Probability I'm dead given that I haven't called = </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="si">:</span><span class="s2">.7f</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">% or one in </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">chance_per_million</span><span class="si">:</span><span class="s2">.1f</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> million  "</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"Probability I'm fine and just forgot to call = </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">%"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Probability I'm dead given that I haven't called = 0.0000468% or one in 2.1 million  
Probability I'm fine and just forgot to call = 99.99995320002107%
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="What-about-if-I-ride-a-motorbike-instead-of-a-car?">What about if I ride a motorbike instead of a car?<a class="anchor-link" href="#What-about-if-I-ride-a-motorbike-instead-of-a-car?">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">UK_fatalities_per_billion_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">119.7</span>
<span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">UK_fatalities_per_billion_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mf">10.0</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">8</span> 
<span class="n">P_not_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span>

<span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
<span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_not_dead</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">52</span>
<span class="n">P_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">P_not_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_not_dead</span><span class="p">)</span> 
                   <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dying_in_10_miles_motorbike</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call_if_dead</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">P_doesnt_call</span>

<span class="n">chance_per_thousand</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"Probability I'm dead given that I haven't called = </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span> <span class="si">:</span><span class="s2">.7f</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">% or one in </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">chance_per_thousand</span><span class="si">:</span><span class="s2">.1f</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> thousand  "</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">"Probability I'm fine and just forgot to call = </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">P_dead_if_doesnt_call</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">%"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

<h1 id="Conclusion:">Conclusion:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusion:">¶</a></h1><p>If I don't call, don't worry I almost certainly just forgot. Although if I ride a motorbike regularly I am very significantly increasing my risk of having a fatal accident over the course of my life.</p>
